com.snap2d.gl

Interface Renderable

  • All Superinterfaces:
    RenderableSpi
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Ball, Entity, EntityManager, GenericEntity, Paddle, PlayerEntity, ScrollWorld

    public interface Renderable
extends RenderableSpi
    Defines a standard for objects that are rendered on screen and called on each tick of the game loop.
    Author:
    Brian Groenke

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onResize(Dimension oldSize, Dimension newSize)
      Called when the Graphics context invoking the Renderable has been resized, allowing the Renderable object to perform necessary scaling.
      void render(Graphics2D g, float interpolation)
      Called when the engine is rendering a new frame.
      void update(long nanoTimeNow, long nanoTimeLast)
      Called on each tick of the game loop.

    • Method Detail

      • render

        void render(Graphics2D g,
          float interpolation)
        Called when the engine is rendering a new frame.
        Parameters:
        g - the Graphics object to draw onto.
        interpolation - the interpolation amount based on time since update was last called.

      • update

        void update(long nanoTimeNow,
          long nanoTimeLast)
        Called on each tick of the game loop. This method is where logic and position updates should take place.
        Specified by:
        update in interface RenderableSpi
        Parameters:
        nanoTimeNow - the fixed nano time at the start of the update cycle
        nanoTimeLast - the fixed nano time of the last update cycle

      • onResize

        void onResize(Dimension oldSize,
            Dimension newSize)
        Called when the Graphics context invoking the Renderable has been resized, allowing the Renderable object to perform necessary scaling.
        Parameters:
        oldSize - the original size of the context (may be null if not yet available).
        newSize - the new size of the grahpics context. This should never be null.
